description: The State of West Virginia Supreme Court of Appeals Wheeling March 18 1865 H To the President Atty Genl of the US Learning that E M Norton Marshal of the District Court of the United States for the District of West Va has resigned or contemplates resigning the office of Marshal it affords me pleasure to recommend to the favorable consideration of your Excellencies as Mr Nortons successor Samuel McCullough Esqr of Wheeling Mr McCullough is thoroughly loyal has served over three years in the U S Army with honor to himself evidenced and acknowledged by promotions has been reared in the Clerks office of his County and is familiar with business is a good businessman and will fill the office I am sure to the satisfaction of all I take the liberty of troubling you with this letter because of information 43618 ac9555 Transcribed and reviewed by contributors participating in the By The People project at crowdlocgov
